translation.text: All the continents, islands and worlds meditate in remembrance.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The nether worlds and spheres meditate in remembrance on that True Lord.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਖਾਣੀ ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਬਾਣੀ ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਸਗਲੇ ਹਰਿ ਜਨਾ ॥੨॥

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਜਖ੍ਯਿ ਦੈਤ ਸਭਿ ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਅਗਨਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਈ ਜਸੁ ਗਨਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The titans and demons all meditate in remembrance; Your Praises are uncountable - they cannot be counted. ||3||

transliteration.text: simarah jakhy dait sabh simarah aganat n jāī jas ganā .3.

text: ਲਤਾ ਬਲੀ ਸਾਖ ਸਭ ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਰਵਿ ਰਹਿਆ ਸੁਆਮੀ ਸਭ ਮਨਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: All the vines and branches meditate in remembrance; O my Lord and Master, You are permeating and pervading all minds. ||4||

transliteration.text: latā balī sākh sabh simarah rav rahiā suāmī sabh manā .4.

text: ਗੁਪਤ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਮੇਰੇ ਸਗਲ ਭਵਨ ਕਾ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਧਨਾ ॥੫॥

translation.text: Both the visible and the invisible meditate in remembrance on my God; God is the Master of all worlds. ||5||

transliteration.text: gupat pragat simarah prabh mērē sagal bhavan kā prabh dhanā .5.

text: ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਗੁਣੀ ਚਤੁਰ ਸਭਿ ਬੇਤੇ ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਰੈਣੀ ਅਰੁ ਦਿਨਾ ॥੬॥

translation.text: All the virtuous, clever and wise people meditate in remembrance; night and day meditate in remembrance. ||6||

transliteration.text: simarah gunī chatur sabh bētē simarah rainī ar dinā .6.

text: ਸਿਮਰਹਿ ਸਉਣ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੰਜੋਗਾ ਅਲਖੁ ਨ ਲਖੀਐ ਇਕੁ ਖਿਨਾ ॥੭॥

translation.text: The Shaastras, with their lucky signs and joinings, meditate in remembrance; the invisible cannot be seen, even for an instant. ||7||

transliteration.text: simarah saun sāsatr sanjōgā alakh n lakhīai ik khinā .7.

text: ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਜਿਸੁ ਭਗਤੀ ਲਾਵਹੁ ਜਨਮੁ ਪਦਾਰਥੁ ਸੋ ਜਿਨਾ ॥੮॥

translation.text: That person, whom You bless with Your Grace, and link to Your devotional service, wins this invaluable human life. ||8||

transliteration.text: kar kirapā jis bhagatī lāvah janam padārath sō jinā .8.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਜਾ ਕੈ ਮਨਿ ਵੂਠਾ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਅਪਨਾ ॥

translation.text: He, within whose mind God dwells,

transliteration.text: jā kai man vūthā prabh apanā .

text: ਪੂਰੈ ਕਰਮਿ ਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਜਪੁ ਜਪਨਾ ॥

translation.text: has perfect karma, and chants the Chant of the Guru.

text: ਸਰਬ ਨਿਰੰਤਰਿ ਸੋ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਜਾਤਾ ਬਹੁੜਿ ਨ ਜੋਨੀ ਭਰਮਿ ਰੁਨਾ ॥੯॥

translation.text: One who realizes God pervading deep within all, does not wander crying in reincarnation again. ||9||

transliteration.text: sarab nirantar sō prabh jātā bahur n jōnī bharam runā .9.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਸਬਦੁ ਵਸੈ ਮਨਿ ਜਾ ਕੈ ॥ ਦੂਖੁ ਦਰਦੁ ਭ੍ਰਮੁ ਤਾ ਕਾ ਭਾਗੈ ॥

translation.text: Pain, sorrow and doubt run away from that one, within whose mind the Word of the Guru's Shabad abides.

transliteration.text: gur kā sabad vasai man jā kai . dūkh darad bhram tā kā bhāgai .

text: ਸੂਖ ਸਹਜ ਆਨੰਦ ਨਾਮ ਰਸੁ ਅਨਹਦ ਬਾਣੀ ਸਹਜ ਧੁਨਾ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: Intuitive peace, poise and bliss come from the sublime essence of the Naam; the unstruck sound current of the Guru's Bani intuitively vibrates and resounds. ||10||

Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਰਹਮੁ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਮਨਿ ਵੂਠਾ ਸੋ ਪੂਰ ਕਰੰਮਾ ਨਾ ਛਿਨਾ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: That person, within whose mind the Supreme Lord God abides, has perfect karma, and becomes famous. ||11||

transliteration.text: pārabraham jā kai man vūthā sō pūr karanmā nā shinā .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The Lord and Master is pervading the water, land and sky.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: There is no other said to be so.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਗੁਰ ਗਿਆਨ ਅੰਜਨਿ ਕਾਟਿਓ ਭ੍ਰਮੁ ਸਗਲਾ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਦੀਸੈ ਏਕ ਬਿਨਾ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: The ointment of the Guru's spiritual wisdom has eradicated all doubts; except the One Lord, I do not see any other at all. ||12||

transliteration.text: gur giān anjan kātiō bhram sagalā avar n dīsai ēk binā .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: The Lord's Court is the highest of the high.

text: ਕਹਣੁ ਨ ਜਾਈ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾਰਾ ॥

translation.text: His limit and extent cannot be described.

transliteration.text: kahan n jāī ant n pārā .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗਹਿਰ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਅਥਾਹ ਸੁਆਮੀ ਅਤੁਲੁ ਨ ਜਾਈ ਕਿਆ ਮਿਨਾ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: The Lord and Master is profoundly deep, unfathomable and unweighable; how can He be measured? ||13||

transliteration.text: gahir ganbhīr athāh suāmī atul n jāī kiā minā .13.

translation.text: You are the Creator; all is created by You.

text: ਤੁਝੁ ਬਿਨੁ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਕੋਈ ਬੀਆ ॥

translation.text: Without You, there is no other at all.

transliteration.text: tujh bin avar n kōī bīā .

text: ਆਦਿ ਮਧਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਤੂਹੈ ਸਗਲ ਪਸਾਰਾ ਤੁਮ ਤਨਾ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: You alone, God, are in the beginning, the middle and the end. You are the root of the entire expanse. ||14||

transliteration.text: ād madh ant prabh tūhai sagal pasārā tum tanā .14.

text: ਸਗਲ ਮਨੋਰਥ ਤਾ ਕੇ ਪੂਰਨ ਜੋ ਸ੍ਰਵਣੀ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਕਾ ਜਸੁ ਸੁਨਾ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: All desires are fulfilled, for one who listens with his ears to the Praises of God. ||15||

transliteration.text: sagal manōrath tā kē pūran jō sravanī prabh kā jas sunā .15.

text: ਤੂ ਸਭਨਾ ਕਾ ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਤੇਰਾ ॥ ਸਾਚੇ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਗਹਿਰ ਗੰਭੀਰਾ ॥

translation.text: You belong to all, and all belong to You, O my true, deep and profound Lord and Master.

transliteration.text: tū sabhanā kā sabh kō tērā . sāchē sāhib gahir ganbhīrā .
